reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: the hotel is in a great location, walking distance from all the sites in the city. the gym is nice, the pool was a bit cold if its not a hot day outside. valet parking is $27 day which includes taxes. unfortunately wifi is free only in the lobby. the staff is very nice, all spoke english. beds were comfortable. would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Quebec is a great place for a vacation in Quebec city. It is conveniently located just outside the Old city, next to the parliament building. Its about a 10minute cab ride from the train station (we arrived via train from Montreal). Being a gold member we were upgraded to an executive room with a view of the city and had access to the lounge as well. The room was well appointed, clean with a good city view despite its slightly smaller size. The lounge on the 23rd floor was fantastic with floor to ceiling glass views of the city, The breakfast and evening snacks served there were also very good. we were also allowed a late checkout of 2pm the next day even though we requested 4pm being gold members. The location is only a 10minute walk to the Chateau Frontenac and all the great restaurants / bistros. overall a great stay and will stay there again if I return to Quebec
reviews.title: Great Stay in a fab City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very dissappointed. The rooms were dated, bathrooms so moldy, listened to a jackhammer 2 nites...so loud we had to leave the room. Fell through a lounge chair at the pool...so old and rickety. The girls at the desk couldnt get their stories straight about bksft being included or not. 3 times we asked, 3 different answers. Certainly a waste of money. The comfort Suites are nicer than this one!! Very disappointed! Won't stay there again. TOO overpriced for what ya get!
reviews.title: not a hilton standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on an upper floor facing the river and found it to be beautiful. The hotel is at the top of a hill and looks over old Quebec. Everything is within walking distance. The views from the executive lounge are amazing, we could even see the images projected down by the waterfront.
reviews.title: Good location, excellent view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location..Probably the best views if you get high floor on the river side from any hotel there in Quebec City. People were nice and friendly..front desk can get a bit slow at times but its a busy hotel with alot of tour groups, etc. - Not a Botique style hotel if thats what you are looking for then I would look in Old City area down on the shopping streets. *** 1 thing to watch for is the "Suites" --- the room we received was large and very nice but the corner suites are really made for a group or family staying all together. There is a main door which opens up to a little area where 3 more doors are. Our 1st night we got someone that was going in and out of their room often and it sounds literally like they are coming into your room because the door is right next to yours. This would be perfect for a group or family all together because you can shut the main door to the hall and no worries from there as all would be quiet.
reviews.title: Nice Stay - Would Go Back There

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights in this Hilton. The hotel is about a ten minute walk to upper town and is next to the convention center. The view from the hotel towards the river is terrific.The hotel is close to Rue St Jean restaurants and there are numerous eating opportunities in upper town or lower town.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Quebec Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our room was clean , service was attentive and hotel/room furnishings were fine. The room sound-proofing could be improved. While we did not hear any conversations from other rooms, we did hear the showers and bathroom flushing from the above room(s), which was both a bit surprising and annoying. Nonetheless, we recommend this hotel for a Quebec stay.
reviews.title: Decent but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am currently staying at this hotel for an international conference. Its location is very convenient, just next to the convention centre where the meeting is held. It also provides easy access to a whole variety of restaurants and places of interest within walking distance. The hotel service is good, staff are professional and efficient. I have great view of the St Laurence river and citadel from my room which is great. The room is also pretty clean. However one would expect the hotel to provide more than the basic services since the price charged per night is not exactly cheap. There is no fridge ion the room, neither are there disposable slippers. There is only one restaurant in the hotel, hardly big enough to cater for the needs of the hotel guests.so my overall take of this hotel is it could do much better to offer more than well needed rest for its guests.
reviews.title: Surprisingly great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Saw a very good rate at this Hilton so I booked it but was concerned that with so many great boutique hotels in QC, was I making a mistake. We were VERY pleased with the service, the room, and the location. First, the staff is very accommodating for US visitors who only speak a few words of French. Unlike the country of France, these folks are nice and willing to help (in the Hilton and throughout the city).
reviews.title: Fantastic Views of Old Quebec and Harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Now about the room....absolutely pay the extra and get a river view, preferably up high. You will never want to leave the room since the view both day and night is spectacular. The room was clean, airy, large and ,a pet peeve of mine, the thermostat worked accurately!!
reviews.title: Decent hotel, very large, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was just at the Hilton Québec again last week and it happened to be at the beginning of union pressure tactics so yes, there weren't enough staff at the reception and check-in line-up was long so I gave up & decided to try later in the AM which paid off. The quality of other service from dining room & cleaning staff was still surprisingly pleasant & good. Given a full house, I lucked out with an upgraded very gorgeous ensuite room on the top floor with view of both the Plaines d'Abraham and Old Quebec. My bed was ok and the numbers of pillows was mindboggling.
reviews.title: A view apart from others!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location - we arrived early and they had a room overlooking the Old City, Parliment and Citadell ready. The room was spotless but it seemed a tiny bit dated. Wonderful bed and linens - free wifi in the lobby. Upscale hotels need to start including this - it is 2012.
reviews.title: At the Gates of the Old City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can walk across the street and cross into the old city gates, see the gorgeous fountain in the roundabout across from the Parliment building. Explore the walled city - upper and lower - such a treasure of architecture and , great people watching along the boardwalk in front of Chateau Frontenac.
reviews.title: Superb Views, excellent base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Eco bus is a great deal to ride back up to the hotel from the lower city - only $1.
reviews.title: It did the trick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Walk along Grande Allee Est for great restaurants, beautiful buildings - even a Starbucks.
reviews.title: Worst check-in experience ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: So this a full service Hilton - and a great one at that. The rooms were very clean, check in was fast and easy. They allowed us to check our bags early and use the swimming pool. The valet was polite, English speaking and fast. Room service was fast and had great options. We were lucky enough to go to the concierge level - beautiful full size connecting rooms (we were there with our daughters) - sadly, you must be 18 in order to go into the concierge lounge. I guess this is great for people who don't want kids around but because they serve alcohol that is the rule. Amazing view of historic Quebec city from most rooms. Easy walking distance to everything you would want to do - don't forget to go the neighborhoods behind the hotel, great local restaurants and shops - away from all the tourist traps of the older part. The old city is amazing but it is crowded with t-shirt shops, tourist trap and has a mix of very good to very bad restaurants.
reviews.title: Room with a view...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife had a convention at the conference center on the property for 4 days so I tagged along so I could experience Quebec City. The Hilton is located so close to everything important to see in the area. The concierge was fantastic giving me lots of information and tips as was the front desk. The room view over the Legislature was amazing! My only negative issues are that for the expensive price of the room there is no fridge in it. Even cheap motels often offer a small bar fridge so why not at this property? Also, there was evidence of mold in the shower grout and I don't think the carpets got vacuumed once in 5 days. The same debris was by the door our whole time there. Not enough to say I would not go back but I must be honest in my review. WIFI only available in the lobby but in our 3rd floor room I did get a signal on my Playbook at times. The Hilton is very nice and I will be back and recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Great experience...but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice property with a great location that is convenient to the old city and has to have the best view in town. The view out of our room has to rank amongst the most spectacular views I've ever experienced from a hotel room and I've been to many beautiful places. This is a big hotel that serves both tourists and business travelers equally well. I suspect it was built in the 70's or 80's but has been updated and is well maintained. You feel like you are in a pretty big slick place. On the day we were there, it was not too expensive, but I suspect their rates vary greatly depending upon demand.
reviews.title: Great view, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only staying for one night. We were greeted with a smile, the staff was very courteous and friendly. They gave us a room with a view overlooking the old city and suggest that we added the breakfast to benefit from one of the best panoramic view in town. Their dinning room is on the highest floor of the hotel and offer a spectacular view of the St Lawrence river, the old port and the Parliament. The room was very clean, the bed comfortable.The hotel is very well located, walkable distance to old city, the Parliament and Citadel. Its ideal if you are planning on partying at night, you don't need to take the car out and drive.Our stay was just perfect and we will definitely stay there again the next time we are in Quebec city.
reviews.title: Unbeleivable view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has the best views of Old Quebec available. Book for access to the Exec Lounge if possible for best panoramic views. Great service from everyone. Only downside is it is a bit of walk to dinner choices but not too far. Only real competion is the Frontenac but this hotel has a great view of the Frontenac that you wouldn't have staying in it. The beds are very comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic View
